name: Problems of the Present
description: The Sword of Kahless has been found and taken. The Empire is out for blood! Find out who took the Sword and why before the cultural festival devolves into a bloodbath.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of K'mpec, Su'kal, Bareil, Lieutenant Sahil, or Cultural Figures will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: K'mpec, Su'kal, Bareil, Lieutenant Sahil, or Cultural Figures
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Syrran
featured_crew.flavor: A Vulcan philosopher who guides Archer and T'Pol across Vulcan's Forge.

featured_crew.name: Su'Kal
featured_crew.flavor: Su'Kal lives in a hologram made by his mother before her death. To be saved, he must face his greatest fear - another reality

featured_crew.name: Bareil
featured_crew.flavor: A moderate member of the Vedek Assembly, Bareil stood againt Winn in the election of the new Kai.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Sisko
rewards.flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Syrran
rewards.flavor: A Vulcan philosopher who guides Archer and T'Pol across Vulcan's Forge.

rewards.name: Bareil
rewards.flavor: A moderate member of the Vedek Assembly, Bareil stood againt Winn in the election of the new Kai.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

adventures.name: Starting Points
adventures.description: Track the last known coordinates of the Sword.

adventures.name: Preserving the Past
adventures.description: Prepare methods to preserve the Sword once recovered.

adventures.name: Keep Your Eyes Sharp
adventures.description: Put out a call to all outposts to search for the Sword.

adventures.name: Mysteries of the Shroud
adventures.description: Return the Shroud of Kahless to the Empire.

rewards.name: Problems of the Present
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Keep Your Eyes Sharp
adventures.description: Put out a call to all outposts to search for the Sword.

adventures.name: Preserving the Past
adventures.description: Prepare methods to preserve the Sword once recovered.

adventures.name: The Usual Suspects
adventures.description: Compile a list of Klingon enemies who might want the Sword.

adventures.name: Mysteries of the Shroud
adventures.description: Return the Shroud of Kahless to the Empire.

rewards.name: Problems of the Present
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Bareil
rewards.flavor: A moderate member of the Vedek Assembly, Bareil stood againt Winn in the election of the new Kai.

rewards.name: Su'Kal
rewards.flavor: Su'Kal lives in a hologram made by his mother before her death. To be saved, he must face his greatest fear - another reality

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain, thank you for answering my hail! I'm afraid we have a crisis on our hands. The Sword of Kahless, once thought lost, has been located. However, the same veiled communication boasting they found it also says they're taking it."
"It is an absolute disgrace! The Sword of Kahless is a holy artifact. To think some weakling is out there brandishing it as if they have any idea of its true value!"
"Captain, as you can see, this is going to require some delicacy. We're counting on you to find out what happened as quickly and quietly as you can."

"Captain, thank you for answering my hail! I'm afraid we have a crisis on our hands. The Sword of Kahless, once thought lost, has been located. However, the same veiled communication boasting they found it also says they're taking it."
"It is an absolute disgrace! The Sword of Kahless is a holy artifact. To think some weakling is out there brandishing it as if they have any idea of its true value!"
"Captain, as you can see, this is going to require some delicacy. We're counting on you to find out what happened as quickly and quietly as you can."
"Captain, thank you for all of your hard work so far. The care you've taken in searching for the Sword of Kahless is greatly appreciated."
"But there are many bat'leths out there, right? Is this 'Sword' truly so valuable?"

responses.text: "The Sword is an important symbol that might unite the Klingon Empire."
"The mythology around the Sword is more important than the item itself."
"The Sword is merely a bat'leth built up over centuries."

screens.text: "Clearly you know nothing of the Sword or its legends. Plucked from the head of Kahless himself and forged in the lava of Kri'Stak, it certainly has more value than some Kelpian upstart!"
"A Sword with the power to unite an Empire? It sounds almost miraculous. And certainly counterintuitive to what a sword would normally do. How fascinating."

"An interesting thought, though I don't necessarily agree. Some artifacts may be mere symbols, but having that tangible connection to one's heritage can be affirming in a way few other things can be."
"And you're merely a Federation lackey, hiding behind a uniform and an insignia. You understand very little if you think the Sword of Kahless can be boiled down in such a crass manner."

"Regardless of the various opinions on the Sword, Captain, I think it's important for us to retrieve it. I believe it's dangerous if left in the wrong hands. I'm counting on you to find it as quickly as possible."
"Captain, thank you for all of your hard work so far. The care you've taken in searching for the Sword of Kahless is greatly appreciated."
"But there are many bat'leths out there, right? Is this 'Sword' truly so valuable?"

responses.text: "The Sword is an important symbol that might unite the Klingon Empire."
"The mythology around the Sword is more important than the item itself."
"The Sword is merely a bat'leth built up over centuries."

screens.text: "Clearly you know nothing of the Sword or its legends. Plucked from the head of Kahless himself and forged in the lava of Kri'Stak, it certainly has more value than some Kelpian upstart!"
"A Sword with the power to unite an Empire? It sounds almost miraculous. And certainly counterintuitive to what a sword would normally do. How fascinating."

"An interesting thought, though I don't necessarily agree. Some artifacts may be mere symbols, but having that tangible connection to one's heritage can be affirming in a way few other things can be."
"And you're merely a Federation lackey, hiding behind a uniform and an insignia. You understand very little if you think the Sword of Kahless can be boiled down in such a crass manner."

"Regardless of the various opinions on the Sword, Captain, I think it's important for us to retrieve it. I believe it's dangerous if left in the wrong hands. I'm counting on you to find it as quickly as possible."
